DOCNAME: CASE OF NURETTIN ALDEMIR AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits (victim) and dismissed;Violation of Art. 11;Remainder inadmissible
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are members of “ EĞİTİM - SEN ” ( Eğitim ve Bilim Emekçileri DATE ORG ) , a trade union which is a member of “ KESK ” ( ORG – ORG ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG prepared a draft bill to amend LAW . While this bill was being discussed in the ORG , “ KESK ” decided to organise meetings in GPE to protest the bill . The aim was to draw public attention to and achieve the withdrawal of this bill , which in their view did not meet international standards .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the Governorship of GPE had issued a circular , providing guidelines on meetings and demonstrations organised in the city of GPE , in accordance with ORG ( Law no . DATE ) . According to this circular , the meeting place chosen by KESK was not among the permitted areas .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , and on DATE PERSON , NORP and PERSON , gathered in FAC together with other persons .

CARDINAL . NORP On both occasions , while the president of “ KESK ” was reading out press statements , police officers warned the demonstrators that their action was contrary to the law and that they had to disperse . The demonstrators blocked the main street of the FAC district ( FAC ) and attempted to march towards ORG . The police officers then intervened and used truncheons , sticks and tear gas with a view to dispersing the crowds . Some of the demonstrators attacked the security forces using pavement stones and sticks which caused the injury of CARDINAL police officers and the destruction of a police vehicle . The applicants were also wounded during the incidents .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON and PERSON were examined by a doctor from ORG . The doctor noted an ecchymosis of QUANTITY on the left eyebrow of ORG . As regards PERSON , he noted an abrasion of QUANTITY on his right eyebrow . PERSON , PERSON and PERSON did not submit any medical evidence to the ORG in support of their subsequent allegations of ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON was examined by a forensic medical expert from ORG who observed an ecchymosis on her lip , a hyperaemic graze on her left wrist and superficial abrasions on her right wrist and arm . The expert concluded that the injuries rendered Arzu Doğan unfit for work for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , NORP was examined by a forensic medical expert from ORG . The doctor observed a sutured injury on the occipital lobe of his head and a haematoma under the injury , and considered that his injuries rendered the applicant unfit for work for DATE .

CARDINAL . Also on DATE , LOC was examined by a doctor from ORG . The doctor observed abrasions on the skin on the left scapula and on the back , and a haematoma of QUANTITY on the right frontal lobe . He concluded that the injuries rendered PERSON unfit for work for DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicants filed a complaint with the GPE public prosecutor ’s office against ORG , the director of ORG , the director of ORG branch of ORG and the police officers who were involved in the incidents .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE the GPE public prosecutor brought charges against CARDINAL demonstrators , including PERSON and PERSON , for violation of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE , pursuant to Law no . DATE on the prosecution of civil servants , the GPE public prosecutor transferred the file to ORG seeking an authorisation to initiate criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , relying on LAW no . DATE , decided not to take an action against the officials and officers accused by the applicants as it found that the allegations were of an “ abstract nature ” . ORG considered that the force used by the police was lawful and justified in the circumstances of the case and that the officers had been under an obligation to disperse the demonstrators who had organised an illegal meeting . This decision was sent to the GPE public prosecutor ’s office on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE ORG acquitted the applicants PERSON and PERSON , as well as other demonstrators , of the charges . The court decided that the demonstrators enjoyed a right to hold unarmed and peaceful meetings and demonstrations without prior permission .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor issued a decision of non - prosecution as regards the applicants’ complaints .
CARDINAL . DATE LAW provides :
“ Everyone has the right to hold unarmed and peaceful meetings and demonstration marches without prior permission . ...
The formalities , conditions , and procedures governing the exercise of the right to hold meetings and demonstration marches shall be prescribed by law . ”
CARDINAL . At the material time section CARDINAL of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) was worded as follows :

“ In order for a meeting to take place , the governor ’s office or authorities of the district in which the demonstration is planned must be informed , during TIME and CARDINAL prior to the meeting , by a notice containing the signature of all the members of the organising board ... ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the same LAW prohibited demonstrations and processions on public streets , in parks , places of worship and buildings in which public services were based . Demonstrations organised in public squares had to comply with security instructions and not disrupt ORG movement or public transport . Finally , section CARDINAL provided that demonstrations and processions which did not comply with the provisions of this law would be dispersed by force on the order of the governor ’s office and after the demonstrators had been warned .
According to a circular issued by the Governorship of GPE on DATE , which provides guidelines on meetings and demonstrations , ORG avenue is not among the permitted areas for demonstrations .
“ The police may use firearms in the event of :
( a ) NORP self defence , ...
( h ) if a person or a group resists the police and prevents them from carrying out their duties or if there is an attack against the police . ”

“ In cases of resistance by persons whose arrest is necessary or by groups whose dispersal is necessary or of their threatening to attack or carrying out an attack , the police may use violence to subdue these actions .

Use of violence refers to the use of bodily force , physical force and all types of weapons specified in the law and it gradually increases according to the nature and level of resistance and attack in such a way as to restore calm .
In cases of intervention by group forces , the extent of the use of force and the equipment and instruments to be used are determined by the commander of the intervening force . ”

CARDINAL . According to LAW , a complainant may file an appeal against the decision of a public prosecutor not to institute criminal proceedings . This appeal must be lodged , within DATE from DATE of notification of the decision to the complainant , with the president of the assize court in whose jurisdiction the public prosecutor works .
